borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposal fails to provide adequate&nbsp;off-street parking, cycle storage and refuse storage that is suitable for a separate unit of accommodation. The lack of clarity associated with the submission means officers cannot determine whether these elements can be accommodated on site, and in the absense of such detail, the proposal is contrary to:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy CR3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BR9, BR19, BR4 of the the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy DMT2 and DMT3 of the The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development by reason of the introduction of a residential dwelling in a rear garden setting would cause an unduly harmful impact on the amenity of No.54 and No.58 Kings Avenue, as well as the host property itself (no.56). The level of noise, comings and going as well as light and general disturbance to the rear garden setting would detrimental to the standard of living of neighbouring residents. The proposal represents an unneighbourly form of development and as such, the proposal is contrary to:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy CP3 of&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed new dwelling by reason of its inadequate provision of daylight and sunlight, limited privacy,&nbsp;lack of internal and external amenity space, and lack of a private access route, provides a poor quality of accommodation for occupiers. The proposal is unsuitable as a separate unit of accommodation. As such, the proposal is contrary to:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, July 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy CM1 and CP3&nbsp;of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BP5, BP6 and&nbsp;BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy SP3 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, Autumn 2021).</span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The&nbsp; design of the proposed development which introduces a residential use to a rear garden setting is considered harmful to the local character and established pattern of development. As such, the proposed development is contrary to: </span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021) </span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021) - Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) </span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)&nbsp;</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The applicant has failed to present plans which accurately portray the development present at the application site. Specifically the plans fail to demonstrate the accurate siting and scale/proportions of the outbuilding, the fenestration arrangement and materiality; the incorrect application form was also submitted. The inaccuracies prevent a full and thorough assessment of the proposal and prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment on the application. As such it cannot be demonstrated that the proposal would be supported by the Development Plan and is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></li></ul>
description: Retrospective application; conversion of outbuilding to self contained unit of accommodation.
